Class VectorUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • VectorUtil

  • public class VectorUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The VectorUtil class contains the necessary functions for manipulation of the Vectors in the Vector and VectorList classes. It contains operations such as addition, subtraction, average etc. as defined in the project guidelines.
    Since:
    26-04-2019
    Author:
    Luke Byrne, Lilian Morgan, Heather Lloyd

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VectorUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector addition(Vector a, Vector b)
      addition() adds two Vectors' respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together
      Vector average(Vector a, Vector b)
      average() adds two Vectors respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together and divides each vector pair in half, in effect finding their average
      double distance(Vector a, Vector b)
      distance() calculates the aptly-named distance between two Vectors.
      double norm(Vector v)
      norm() squares each of the vector components, adds them up, and then finds the square root of their total sum i.e.
      Vector scalarMultiplication(Vector v, int scalar)
      scalarMultiplication() takes one vector and multiplies its vector components by a scalar (a whole number which changes the magnitude, but not the direction, of a vector).
      static double similarity(Vector a, Vector b)
      similarity() calculates the apparent closeness of two words using a mathematical formula known as the cosinus similarity, whose formula is written below: similarity(va, vb) = ((va.vec1 * vb.vec1) + ...
      Vector subtraction(Vector a, Vector b)
      subtraction() substracts one Vector's respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension from another

      • addition

        public Vector addition(Vector a,
                       Vector b)
        addition() adds two Vectors' respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together
        Parameters:
        a - = first vector
        b - = second vector
        Returns:
        sum = the Vector containing their joint additive values
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • subtraction

        public Vector subtraction(Vector a,
                          Vector b)
        subtraction() substracts one Vector's respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension from another
        Parameters:
        a - = first vector
        b - = second vector
        Returns:
        Vector diff, the Vector containing their subtracted values, otherwise known as difference
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • average

        public Vector average(Vector a,
                      Vector b)
        average() adds two Vectors respective vector arrays of 'd' dimension together and divides each vector pair in half, in effect finding their average
        Parameters:
        a - = first vector
        b - = second vector
        Returns:
        av = contains the vectors' averages
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • scalarMultiplication

        public Vector scalarMultiplication(Vector v,
                                   int scalar)
        scalarMultiplication() takes one vector and multiplies its vector components by a scalar (a whole number which changes the magnitude, but not the direction, of a vector).
        Parameters:
        v - = the vector
        scalar - = the scalar to multiply the vector by
        Returns:
        v = the vector from input with all its components multiplied by the scalar from input
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • norm

        public double norm(Vector v)
        norm() squares each of the vector components, adds them up, and then finds the square root of their total sum i.e. Math.sqrt(v.vec1^2 + v.vec2^2 + ... v.vecd^2), which effectively calculates the magnitude of the Vector
        Parameters:
        v - = the vector for whom the norm is calculated
        Returns:
        Math.sqrt(sum) - returns the equation described above
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • distance

        public double distance(Vector a,
                       Vector b)
        distance() calculates the aptly-named distance between two Vectors. This is calculated with the following formula: - Math.sqrt((va.vec1 - vb.vec1)^2) + (va.vec2 - vb.vec2)^2 + ... ... + (va.vecd - vb.vecd)^2)
        Parameters:
        a - = first vector
        b - = second vector
        Returns:
        Math.sqrt(sum) - the result of the formula described above
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • similarity

        public static double similarity(Vector a,
                                Vector b)
        similarity() calculates the apparent closeness of two words using a mathematical formula known as the cosinus similarity, whose formula is written below: similarity(va, vb) = ((va.vec1 * vb.vec1) + ... (va.vecd * vb.vecd)) / (divided by next line) [[[ Math.sqrt((va.vec1)^2 + ... (va.vecd)^2)) * Math.sqrt((vb.vec1)^2 ... (vb.vecd)^2) ]]]
        Parameters:
        a - = first vector
        b - = second vector
        Returns:
        numerator / denominator = i.e. returns the cosinus similarity of the two vectors
        Since:
        26-04-2019
